title: Love Island's Amber Gill shades Michael Griffiths' Ex On The Beach stint
text:
Amber Gill has addressed Michael Griffith’s Ex On The Beach stint (Picture: Getty)

Michael ‘Childish’ Griffiths was recently rumoured to be taking part in Ex On The Beach, after his quest for romance ended a little awkwardly on Love Island.

And Amber Gill has thrown a sprinkling of shade her ex’s way, when asked about his upcoming appearance.

When asked for her thoughts on his next venture, the 22-year-old told Metro.co.uk exclusively: ‘Good for him… That’s a good opportunity for him, I have to say.

‘That is a good opportunity.’

But she insisted we wouldn’t be seeing her rocking up to said beach anytime soon, continuing: ‘I haven’t got time to be doing things like Ex On The Beach…’

Well, she has just signed a £1million deal with Miss Pap and launched her first collection for the brand, so she does have a point.

Michael is rumoured to be taking part on the MTV series (Picture: Rex)

Love Island came to an end earlier this year, with the contestants plagued with ‘feud’ rumours ever since.

Advertisement

And those claims increased when Lucie Donlan claimed none of the other Islanders really spoke to Molly-Mae Hague anymore.

So. Much. Drama.

But Amber is adamant the ITV2 stars aren’t rowing, but it’s just natural they’re drifting apart.

‘The majority of the time it’s not a feud, it’s just life,’ she continued. ‘You’ve got your friends, and you’ve got people that you know, but you don’t speak to them every day.

Amber has stayed close to Anna Vakili since leaving the Love Island villa (Picture: Splash)

‘It’s just exactly the same as that.

‘Especially when you see what they said about you…’

Noted…

‘I think it would be impossible to keep in touch with like 35 different people, maybe more than that,’ she explained further. ‘That would be impossible.

‘In real life, you wouldn’t get along with everybody. The majority of the girls I get along with really well.’

Amber penned a £1million Miss Pap deal (Picture: Splash)

Amber had a lot of eyes on her when she left the Love Island villa – with many questioning what her next step would be following her split from Greg O’Shea.

However, she revealed she doesn’t see herself in competition with any of her co-stars – after Maura Higgins and India Reynolds unveiled Boohoo collections and Molly-Mae released a PrettyLittleThing line.

‘I don’t feel like I’m in competition because I’m quite different,’ she added. ‘I feel like, if a certain brand wants to work with me, they wouldn’t want to work with…

‘There’s a reason why [they approached me]. All of us are very different in different ways. So I don’t feel that side of the competition at all.’

And we’re guessing that £1million paycheque feels pretty good, too…
